name: BurstBalance
description: The percent of General Purpose SSD (gp2) burst-bucket I/O credits available.

name: CPUUtilization
description: The percentage of CPU utilization.

name: CPUCreditUsage
description: (T2 instances) The number of CPU credits spent by the instance for CPU utilization. One CPU credit equals one vCPU running at 100 percent utilization for one minute or an equivalent combination of vCPUs, utilization, and time.

name: CPUCreditBalance
description: (T2 instances) The number of earned CPU credits that an instance has accrued since it was launched or started. For T2 Standard, the CPUCreditBalance also includes the number of launch credits that have been accrued. Credits are accrued in the credit balance after they are earned, and removed from the credit balance when they are spent. The credit balance has a maximum limit, determined by the instance size. After the limit is reached, any new credits that are earned are discarded. For T2 Standard, launch credits don't count towards the limit.

name: CPUSurplusCreditBalance
description: The number of surplus credits that have been spent by an unlimited instance when its CPUCreditBalance value is zero.

name: CPUSurplusCreditsCharged
description: The number of spent surplus credits that are not paid down by earned CPU credits, and which thus incur an additional charge.

name: DatabaseConnections
description: The number of database connections in use. The metric value might not include broken database connections that haven't been cleaned up by your database yet. So, the number of database connections recorded by your database might be higher than the metric value.

name: DiskQueueDepth
description: The number of outstanding I/Os (read/write requests) waiting to access the disk.

name: FreeableMemory
description: The amount of available random access memory.

name: FreeStorageSpace
description: The amount of available storage space.

name: MaximumUsedTransactionIDs
description: The maximum transaction IDs that have been used. Applies to PostgreSQL.

name: NetworkReceiveThroughput
description: The incoming (receive) network traffic on the DB instance, including both customer database traffic and Amazon RDS traffic used for monitoring and replication.

name: NetworkTransmitThroughput
description: The outgoing (transmit) network traffic on the DB instance, including both customer database traffic and Amazon RDS traffic used for monitoring and replication.

name: OldestReplicationSlotLag
description: The lagging size of the replica lagging the most in terms of write-ahead log (WAL) data received. Applies to PostgreSQL.

name: ReadIOPS
description: The average number of disk read I/O operations per second.

name: ReadLatency
description: The average amount of time taken per disk I/O operation.

name: ReadThroughput
description: The average number of bytes read from disk per second.

name: ReplicaLag
description: The amount of time a read replica DB instance lags behind the source DB instance. Applies to MySQL, MariaDB, Oracle, PostgreSQL, and SQL Server read replicas.

name: ReplicationSlotDiskUsage
description: The disk space used by replication slot files. Applies to PostgreSQL.

name: SwapUsage
description: The amount of swap space used on the DB instance. This metric is not available for SQL Server.

name: TransactionLogsDiskUsage
description: The disk space used by transaction logs. Applies to PostgreSQL.

name: TransactionLogsGeneration
description: The size of transaction logs generated per second. Applies to PostgreSQL.

name: WriteIOPS
description: The average number of disk write I/O operations per second.

name: WriteLatency
description: The average amount of time taken per disk I/O operation.

name: WriteThroughput
description: The average number of bytes written to disk per second.
